item.title: Nicole add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Most of us are called on to perform tasks far beyond what we can do. Our capabilities seldom match our aspirations, and we are often woefully unprepared. To this extent, we are all Assistant Pig-Keepers at heart." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Anthony Bourdain
item.description: "Vegetarians, and their Hezbollah-like splinter faction, the vegans ... are the enemy of everything good and decent in the human spirit." -- Anthony Bourdain

item.title: Nicole add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I found myself thinking about President William McKinley, the third American president to be assassinated. He lived for several days after he was shot, and towards the end, his wife started crying and screaming, "I want to go too! I want to go too!" And with his last measure of strength, McKinley turned to her and spoke his last words: "We are all going." -- John Green

item.title: Nicole add a quote by John Green
item.description: "When I look at my room, I see a girl who loves books." -- John Green

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Scott Westerfield
item.description: "The human heart is a strange vessel. Love and hatred can exist side by side." -- Scott Westerfield

item.title: Nicole add a quote by John Bellairs
item.description: "He invented the Fuse Box Dwarf, a little man who popped out at you from behind the paint cans in the cellarway and screamed, "Dreeb! Dreeb! I am the Fuse Box Dwarf!" Lewis was not scared by the little man, and he felt that those who scream "Dreeb" are more to be pitied than censured." -- John Bellairs

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description: "Bruises mapped my body from bumping into tables and tripping over curbs while walking with a book in my hand, my eyes focused on the pages instead of the live space around me." -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "You didn't kill him. He would have killed you, but you didn't kill him." "So? He was stupid. If I killed everyone who was stupid, I wouldn't have time to sleep." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Diana Wynne Jones
item.description: "I am a believer in free will. If my dog chooses to hate the whole human race except myself, it must be free to do so." -- Diana Wynne Jones

item.title: Nicole add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Nicole add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Don't underestimate the value of Doing Nothing, of just going along, listening to all the things you can't hear, and not bothering." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description:
"Listen, haircut...'
Did you just call me <i>haircut</i>?' he asked.
Yes. You know there's no reason we can't go online. It's crazy.'
Why'd you call me haircut?' he asked, touching his hair. 'Is it because I have a great haircut?'
You figure it out,' she answered.
-Clio and Aiden, Girl At Sea by Maureen Johnson" -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Hold on." He grabbed a pencil and scrawled excitedly at the paper as if he'd just made a mathematical breakthrough and then looked back up at me. "I just did some calculations, and I've been able to determine that you're full of shit." -- John Green

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "Miss Tarabotti was not one of life's milk-water misses--in fact, quite the opposite. Many a gentleman had likened his first meeting with her to downing a very strong cognac when one was expecting to imbibe fruit juice--that is to say, startling and apt to leave one with a distinct burning sensation." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "I have no phobias. Phobias are irrational. My fears are rational and CAREFULLY CULTIVATED, like roses." -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "<i>I</i> care for myself. The more solitary, the more friendless, the more unsustained I am, the more I will respect myself." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Blessed are the cracked, for they shall let in the light." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The circus arrives without warning. No announcements precede it. It is simply there, when yesterday it was not." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You think, as you walk away from Le Cirque des Rêves and into the creeping dawn, that you felt more awake within the confines of the circus. You are no longer quite certain which side of the fence is the dream." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Most maidens are perfectly capable of rescuing themselves in my experience, at least the ones worth something, in any case." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "I am tired of trying to hold things together that cannot be held. Trying to control what cannot be controlled. I am tired of denying myself what I want for fear of breaking things I cannot fix. They will break no matter what we do." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "To be rather than to seem." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "He is slow, and the sea sings to us both, but he returns to me." -- Maggie Stiefvater
